channel.title: Talks By M. Russell Ballard
channel.description: General Conference talks by M. Russell Ballard.

image.title: General Conference talks by M. Russell Ballard.

item.title: Spiritual Development
item.description: On behalf of all of us, I’d like to say, we love you, President Young.

item.title: You Can Be the Voice
item.description: This is a great honor for me to address you, my brethren, and I seek the Spirit of the Lord that what I say might help each of us want to become better members of the Church and serve more diligently in the priesthood.

item.title: The Savior’s Touch
item.description: Since last conference, I have come to know that many of our Heavenly Father’s children need help with their problems. Hundreds of letters filled with pleas for help have come to the General Authorities. Fathers plead for their sons, mothers for their

item.title: Providing for Our Needs
item.description: My brothers and sisters, I have been asked to talk about family finances with you today.

item.title: Teaching—No Greater Call
item.description: For the past several years, I have served as Executive Director of the Church Curriculum Department. When I became fully aware of the immense effort required to prepare a single course of study, I was overwhelmed. I now have much greater appreciation

item.title: Write Down a Date
item.description: I pray that my message might be received in the spirit of the address of Elder Oaks.

item.title: Prepare to Serve
item.description: Just fifteen days ago, by assignment, I left Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, which is approximately ten thousand miles from here. The world is very small in some ways. Had I been able to fly directly from Addis Ababa to Salt Lake City, it would have taken app

item.title: In Response to the Call
item.description: My brothers and sisters, I am deeply humbled at the confidence of the Lord and my Brethren and pledge to you that I will do the very best I know how. The past nine and a half years, as I have been sent on errands for the Lord throughout the earth, ha

item.title: The Kingdom Rolls Forth in South America
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters: my wife, Barbara, our family, and I express to you our deep appreciation for your messages of love and support since my call last October to the Council of the Twelve Apostles.

item.title: We Proclaim the Gospel
item.description: The Prophet Joseph Smith was often asked to inquire of the Lord to learn what people should do. In the case of John Whitmer, the Lord said, “And now, behold, I say unto you, that the thing which will be of the most worth unto you will be to declare r

item.title: Keeping Life’s Demands in Balance
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, since last general conference, I have felt in my own life the power of priesthood blessings and the power of the faith and prayers of Church members. For many years, I have given blessings to others. I have fasted and pr

item.title: Sacrifice and Self-Sufficiency
item.description: This has been a wonderful conference, brothers and sisters. I pray that my few remarks will not detract from the spirit we have enjoyed.

item.title: God’s Love for His Children
item.description: Brothers and sisters, this is a beautiful time of year with spring beginning to burst forth in many parts of the world, bringing all of its colors, scents, and cheerful sounds. The miracle of the changing seasons, with the reawakening and rebirth in

item.title: The Hand of Fellowship
item.description: Brothers and sisters, the topic I wish to address is one about which the Brethren are deeply concerned. I have titled my remarks “The Hand of Fellowship.”

item.title: The Effects of Television
item.description: This has been another wonderful conference, brothers and sisters. I am sure we all appreciate the inspired and timely messages we have heard. They have been translated simultaneously into twenty-nine languages, many of which have been broadcast via s

item.title: Duties, Rewards, and Risks
item.description: My brothers and sisters, since April’s general conference, some of our missionaries have found themselves in increasingly more difficult circumstances. As the adviser to the South America North Area Presidency, I was saddened, as I know you were, at

item.title: Small and Simple Things
item.description: Brothers and sisters, I suppose you are as amazed as I am with the monumental world events that we see unfolding. As Latter-day Saints, we recognize the hand of God working to bring about his purposes in the earth. We know that the “stone [that] was

item.title: Purity Precedes Power
item.description: My remarks are directed, primarily, to you young men of the Aaronic Priesthood. The subject is the moral cleanliness of our youth. The leaders of the Church care so deeply about every one of you that I feel an urgent need to warn you once again of th

item.title: Teach the Children
item.description: During this past Christmas season, I had the privilege of participating in the Washington, D.C., Visitors’ Center Christmas lighting celebration. When I turned on the 200,000 lights, they seemed to dance and sparkle in the trees, with the majestic te

item.title: Be an Example of the Believers
item.description: My dear sisters, both young and not so young, speaking to you for a few minutes tonight is a distinct honor for me. I pray that the Lord will bless me that my remarks will be helpful to each one of you.

item.title: The Blessings of Sacrifice
item.description: Last October we listened to many inspired conference messages. In his Sunday morning address, President Gordon B. Hinckley called to our attention some of the poignant experiences of our pioneer forefathers whose sacrifices helped them lay the founda

item.title: The Joy of Hope Fulfilled
item.description: Living in these difficult times, brothers and sisters, requires each one of us to maintain a positive, hopeful perspective about the future. Today, more so than in the past, I am asked about the signs of the times and if I think the end of the world

item.title: Keeping Covenants
item.description: This morning I want to speak primarily to the young men and young women of the Church. I pray for the Spirit to help me inspire you young people to want to live righteous lives.

item.title: Equality through Diversity
item.description: I am honored to speak to you sisters of the Relief Society. Each one of you is a part of the largest and oldest women’s organization in the world and the only one organized by a prophet of God. I bring you greetings from the First Presidency and the

item.title: Strength in Counsel
item.description: The Brethren have taught plain and precious truths about the gospel of Jesus Christ from this pulpit during this conference. I bear testimony that we have heard “the will of the Lord, … the mind of the Lord, … the word of the Lord, … the voice of the

item.title: Counseling with Our Councils
item.description: Before I was called as a General Authority, I was in the automobile business, as was my father before me. Through the years I learned to appreciate the sound and the performance of a well-tuned engine. To me it is almost musical, from the gentle purr

item.title: Restored Truth
item.description: Three weeks ago I was assigned to host an open house at the Orlando Florida Temple for leaders representing the clergy, press, government, education, and business. Before I escorted these prominent guests through the temple, I explained to them the p

item.title: Answers to Life’s Questions
item.description: Life’s most challenging questions seem to be those that begin with the word “Why is life so hard?” “Why is there so much sorrow, hate, and unhappiness in the world?” “Why does death take the young?” And “why must the innocent suffer?” We all have wr

item.title: Hyrum Smith: “Firm As the Pillars of Heaven”
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, I am grateful to be able to stand before you today. After undergoing heart-bypass surgery two months ago, I am grateful to be able to stand anywhere. I have felt the powerful faith and prayers of Church members exercised

item.title: Feasting at the Lord’s Table
item.description: Brothers and sisters, this has been another glorious conference. I pray for the Spirit of the Lord to be with me as I now have the privilege to speak to you.

item.title: Faith in Every Footstep
item.description: This year, 1996, we have enjoyed a great centennial celebration of statehood in Utah that has given our citizens an opportunity to reflect upon the important accomplishments of the past 100 years. In 1997 the Church will celebrate the 150th anniversa

item.title: “You Have Nothing to Fear from the Journey”
item.description: No matter how difficult the trail … we can take comfort in knowing that others before us have borne life’s most grievous trials and tragedies by looking to heaven.

item.title: Standing for Truth and Right
item.description: Standing for truth and right is not solely a Sunday thing. Every day our neighborhoods and communities are in desperate need of our support and our commitment to safety and law and order.

item.title: Marvelous Are the Revelations of the Lord
item.description: We need to embrace, study, and appreciate the revealed truths that are ours. We need to declare the gospel generously and kindly to all of our Father’s children.

item.title: Are We Keeping Pace?
item.description: Every council … should be working together on ways to be more effective in preparing our members … to enjoy all the blessings of the Church and … the temple.

item.title: Like a Flame Unquenchable
item.description: One thing is certain: the commandments have not changed. … Right is still right. Wrong is still wrong, no matter how cleverly cloaked in respectability or political correctness.

item.title: Beware of False Prophets and False Teachers
item.description: Beware of those who speak and publish in opposition to God’s true prophets.

item.title: “How Is It with Us?”
item.description: The most important thing every one of us can do is to examine our own commitment and devotion to the Lord Jesus Christ.

item.title: Now Is the Time
item.description: If we do not … willingly teach others of the Restoration of the gospel of Jesus Christ through the Prophet Joseph Smith, who will?

item.title: “His Word Ye Shall Receive”
item.description: It is no small thing, my brothers and sisters, to have a prophet of God in our midst. Great and wonderful are the blessings that come into our lives as we listen to the word of the Lord given to us through him.

item.title: Doctrine of Inclusion
item.description: If we are truly disciples of the Lord Jesus Christ, we will reach out with love and understanding to all of our neighbors at all times.

item.title: The Peaceable Things of the Kingdom
item.description: Peace—real peace, whole-souled to the very core of your being—comes only in and through faith in the Lord Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Greatest Generation of Missionaries
item.description: We call upon you, our young brethren of the Aaronic Priesthood, to rise up, to measure up, and to be fully prepared to serve the Lord.

item.title: The Essential Role of Member Missionary Work
item.description: We must prepare ourselves to assist the missionaries in finding those of our Heavenly Father’s children who will embrace the message of the Restoration.

item.title: Let Our Voices Be Heard
item.description: Let us speak out and encourage a more uplifting, inspiring, and acceptable media.

item.title: The Atonement and the Value of One Soul
item.description: If we could truly understand the Atonement of the Lord Jesus Christ, we would realize how precious is one son or daughter of God.

item.title: Pure Testimony
item.description: Testimony—real testimony, born of the Spirit and confirmed by the Holy Ghost—changes lives.

item.title: One More
item.description: We need more hardworking, testimony-enriched missionaries in order to reach more of our Heavenly Father’s children.

item.title: What Matters Most Is What Lasts Longest
item.description: As your leaders, we call upon members of the Church everywhere to put family first and to identify specific ways to strengthen their individual families.

item.title: Creating a Gospel-Sharing Home
item.description: Creating a gospel-sharing home is the easiest and most effective way that we can share the gospel.

item.title: O Be Wise
item.description: May we focus on the simple ways we can serve in the kingdom of God, always striving to change lives, including our own.

item.title: The Miracle of the Holy Bible
item.description: We are true and full believers in the Lord Jesus Christ and in His revealed word through the Holy Bible.

item.title: Faith, Family, Facts, and Fruits
item.description: The growing prominence of the Church and the increasing inquiries from others present us with great opportunities to build bridges, make friends, and pass on accurate information.

item.title: Daughters of God
item.description: There is no role in life more essential and more eternal than that of motherhood.

item.title: The Truth of God Shall Go Forth
item.description: This is God’s work, and God’s work will not be frustrated. But there is still much to be done.

item.title: Learning the Lessons of the Past
item.description: Learning the lessons of the past allows you to build personal testimony on a solid bedrock of obedience, faith, and the witness of the Spirit.

item.title: Fathers and Sons: A Remarkable Relationship
item.description: Fathers and sons can play a critical role in helping each other become the best that they can be.

item.title: Mothers and Daughters
item.description: In these last days it is essential—even critical—that parents and children listen to and learn from one another.

item.title: O That Cunning Plan of the Evil One
item.description: There is hope for the addicted, and this hope comes through the Atonement of the Lord Jesus Christ.

item.title: Finding Joy through Loving Service
item.description: May we show our love and appreciation for the Savior’s atoning sacrifice through our simple, compassionate acts of service.

item.title: The Importance of a Name
item.description: Let us develop the habit … of making it clear that The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is the name by which the Lord Himself has directed that we be known.

item.title: That the Lost May Be Found
item.description: As you seek to live the gospel and doctrine of Christ, the Holy Ghost will guide you and your family.

item.title: Be Anxiously Engaged
item.description: Great things are brought about and burdens are lightened through the efforts of many hands “anxiously engaged in a good cause.”

item.title: “This Is My Work and Glory”
item.description: God has freely given His power to those who accept and honor His priesthood, which leads to the promised blessings of immortality and eternal life.

item.title: Put Your Trust in the Lord
item.description: Become engaged in doing what you can in sharing the great message of the Restoration of the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Following Up
item.description: M. Russell Ballard encourages Latter-day Saints to be faithful missionaries and to follow up on their missionary efforts.

item.title: Stay in the Boat and Hold On!
item.description: We will be safe and protected if we follow the teachings of the Church and the counsel of the modern prophets and apostles.

item.title: The Greatest Generation of Young Adults
item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballard encourages returned missionaries and all young adults to live gospel standards of righteous discipleship.

item.title: God Is at the Helm
item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballard reminds us that God is at the helm and that if we keep the covenants we have made, we will be blessed and protected.

item.title: To Whom Shall We Go?
item.description: Elder Ballard asks us to consider where we will turn to if we turn away from the Church of Jesus Christ when our faith is tested. If we stay, we are blessed.

item.title: Return and Receive
item.description: Elder Ballard invites us to do all we can to be able to return to our Heavenly Parents and receive the blessings that They have in store for us.
